tit.e: Minryoku-Kyuyou/Seihi-Setsugen (Rest for People and Expense Savings)
Minryoku-Kyuyou and Seihi-Setsugen (Rest for Financial Resources of People and Reduction of Government Expenses)
tit.cmt: 「政費」の「政」の部分が翻訳されてませんでした。
tit.e: Minryoku-Kyuyou and Seihi-Setsugen (Rest for Financial Resources of People and Reduction of Government Expenses)

sen.j: 民力休養・政費節減（みんりょくきゅうよう・せいひせつげん）とは、明治時代の初期帝国議会において民党側が掲げた公約。
sen.e: Minryoku-Kyuyou/Seihi-Setsugen (Rest for People and Expense Savings) refers to the policy pledge of minto (general term of the political parties such as the Liberal Party and Progressive Party that conflicted with a han-dominated government when the Imperial Diet was inaugurated) in early the Imperial Diet of the Meiji Period.

Minryoku-Kyuyou and Seihi-Setsugen referred to the policy pledge of Minto (general term of the political parties such as the Liberal Party and Progressive Party that conflicted with a han-dominated government when the Imperial Diet was inaugurated) in early the Imperial Diet of the Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: Minryoku-Kyuyou/Seihi-Setsugenの単語がもう翻訳されたので削減しました。
sen.e: Minryoku-Kyuyou and Seihi-Setsugen referred to the policy pledge of Minto (general term of the political parties such as the Liberal Party and Progressive Party that conflicted with a han-dominated government when the Imperial Diet was inaugurated) in early the Imperial Diet of the Meiji Period.

sen.j: 政費節減を経費節減（けいひせつげん）と表記する場合もある。
sen.e: Seihi-Setsugen (Expense Savings) may also be written as Keihi-Setsugen (Budget Savings).
Seihi-Setsugen (Reduction of Government Expense) may also be written as Keihi-Setsugen (Budget Savings).
sen.cmt: 「政費」の「政」の部分が翻訳されてませんでした。
sen.e: Seihi-Setsugen (Reduction of Government Expense) may also be written as Keihi-Setsugen (Budget Savings).

sen.j: 産業振興や軍備拡張によって、財政膨張を続ける政府財政の無駄を削減して（政費節減/経費節減）、その削減分に相応した地租などを削減して重税に苦しむ国民の負担を軽減して（民力休養）、国民生活の再建を図るべきとする主張である。
sen.e: Minryoku-Kyuyou/Seihi-Setsugen was the assertion that waste in the government's finances, which grew continuously due to industrial advancement and the buildup of armaments, should be reduced (Seihi-Setsugen/Keihi-Setsugen) and the tax burden on people suffering from heavy taxation should be alleviated by a reduction in the amount of land tax that would correspond to the amount of the reduction in waste (Minryoku-Kyuyou), with the aim of reconstructing people's lives.

Minryoku-Kyuyou and Seihi-Setsugen asserted the reduction in the waste in the growing government's finances due to industrial advancement and the build up of armaments (Seihi-Setsugen and Keihi-Setsugen), and the alleviation of tax burden on people suffering from heavy taxation by a reduction of the land tax with a decrease of waste (Minryoku-Kyuyou) to reestablish lives of people.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: Minryoku-Kyuyou and Seihi-Setsugen asserted the reduction in the waste in the growing government's finances due to industrial advancement and the build up of armaments (Seihi-Setsugen and Keihi-Setsugen), and the alleviation of tax burden on people suffering from heavy taxation by a reduction of the land tax with a decrease of waste (Minryoku-Kyuyou) to reestablish lives of people.

sen.j: 地租の軽減は自由民権運動の主力が地主・農民に移った1880年代以後盛んになっており、1887年の三大事件建白書においても「外交の刷新」「言論・集会の自由」と並んで掲げられていた。
sen.e: Reduction of the land tax was increasingly asserted after 1880 when the principal members of Jiyu Minken Undo (the Freedom and People's Rights Movement) shifted to landowners and peasants, and it was aimed along with "Gaikou no Satsushin" (revamping of foreign diplomacy) and "Genron/Syukai no Jiyuu" (freedom of speech/assembly) also in Sandai Jiken Kenpakusyo (the petition of three major matters) in 1887.
sen.cmt: 「地租の軽減の主張は」、もしくは「以降盛んに主張されており」として訳出しました。
sen.e: Reduction of the land tax was increasingly asserted after 1880 when the principal members of Democratic-Rights Movement shifted to landowners and peasants, and it was aimed along with "Gaikou no Satsushin" (revamping of foreign diplomacy) and "Genron and Syukai no Jiyuu" (freedom of speech and assembly) also in Sandai Jiken Kenpakusyo (the petition of three major matters) in 1887.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: Reduction of the land tax was increasingly asserted after 1880 when the principal members of Democratic-Rights Movement shifted to landowners and peasants, and it was aimed along with "Gaikou no Satsushin" (revamping of foreign diplomacy) and "Genron and Syukai no Jiyuu" (freedom of speech and assembly) also in Sandai Jiken Kenpakusyo (the petition of three major matters) in 1887.

sen.j: 1889年の大同団結運動分裂の際に成立した大同倶楽部が「財政を整理し、民力の休養を謀ること」を綱領に掲げて以後、対立した大同協和会（後の立憲自由党）、更に立憲改進党を巻き込んで民党勢力共通の公約となった。
sen.e: Since the political party called "Daido Kurabu", which was formed at the time of the breakup of Daido Danketsu Undo (the movement to unite for a common purpose) in 1889, advocated "reconstructing finance and aiming for rest for laborers" in their platform, it became a policy pledge that was shared by minto (general term of the political parties such as the Liberal Party and Progressive Party that conflicted with the han-dominated government when the Imperial Diet was inaugurated), involving Daido Kyowa Kai in a conflict with Daido Kurabu (later, Rikken Jiyuu To [the Constitutional Liberal Party]) and Rikken Kaishin To (the Constitutional Progressive Party).
sen.cmt: 主語を追加しました。が、この文脈だと、「政費節減」もしくは「地租の軽減」のどちらが主語か判然としませんでしたので、主語として、 ｉｔ を使用しました。
sen.e: Since the political party called "Daido Kurabu" (Great Club) formed when Great Merger Movement disbanded in 1889 advocated "reconstructing finance and aiming for rest for laborers," it became a policy pledge that was shared by Minto, involving confronting Daido Kyowa Kai (later Constitutional Liberal Party) and the Constitutional Progressive Party.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: Since the political party called "Daido Kurabu" (Great Club) formed when Great Merger Movement disbanded in 1889 advocated "reconstructing finance and aiming for rest for laborers," it became a policy pledge that was shared by Minto, involving confronting Daido Kyowa Kai (later Constitutional Liberal Party) and the Constitutional Progressive Party.

sen.j: 帝国議会開設後、民党勢力は具体的に地租を地価の2.5％から2％に引き下げるように要求して、衆議院において度々予算の減額修正を図った。
sen.e: After the Imperial Diet was inaugurated, minto demanded reducing the land tax specifically from 2.5% to 2% of the land price and tried to reduce the budget in the House of Representatives.
After the Imperial Diet was inaugurated, Minto specifically demanded the land tax reduction 2 to 2.5% of the land price and tried to decrease the budget of the House of Representatives.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: After the Imperial Diet was inaugurated, Minto specifically demanded the land tax reduction 2 to 2.5% of the land price and tried to decrease the budget of the House of Representatives.

sen.j: だが、貴族院 (日本)はこれに消極的であり結果的に要求を貫徹できなかった。
sen.e: However, the House of Peers was reluctant to reduce the tax, and, as a result, minto coud not realize their goal.
However, Minto could not realize their goal since the House of Peers was reluctant to reduce the tax.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: However, Minto could not realize their goal since the House of Peers was reluctant to reduce the tax.

sen.j: 一方、民党に対峙する吏党もこの方針には一概に反対ではなかったが、地租の削減よりも現実的な地租納期の端境期への変更（米価が高い時期に換金して納税すれば、結果的に農民の負担は軽くなる）を求めた。
sen.e: On the other hand, rito (pro-government political parties), which conflicted with minto, did not fully disapprove this principle; however, rito demanded changing the time to pay land tax to the pre-harvest months (if rice is converted into cash while the rice price was high for paying tax, the burden on peasants would be reduced as a result), which was more feasible than reducing land tax.

On the other hand, Rito (pro-government political parties) opposing Minto, did not generally disagreed with this principle and demanded to shift the land tax payday to the pre-harvest months (the burden on peasants would be reduced if rice is exchanged to cash while the rice price was high for paying tax), which was more feasible than reducing land tax.
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: On the other hand, Rito (pro-government political parties) opposing Minto, did not generally disagreed with this principle and demanded to shift the land tax payday to the pre-harvest months (the burden on peasants would be reduced if rice is exchanged to cash while the rice price was high for paying tax), which was more feasible than reducing land tax.

sen.j: ところが、日清戦争の前後より、社会構造の変化に伴って米価が上昇基調のまま推移するようになり、相対的に古いままの地価を基にした税額に対して負担が軽くなる現象が生じた。
sen.e: However, around the time of the Japanese-Sino War, the price of rice remained on an upward trend along with changes in the social structure, thereby causing a phenomenon whereby the burden was reduced since the tax amount still based on a relatively old land price.

However, the price of rice remained on an upward trend along with changes in the social structure around the time of the Japanese-Sino War, causing a phenomenon of burden reduction since the tax was still based on a relatively old land price.

sen.j: また、当時の歳出は公債返済の占める割合が多く削減の割合が多かったこと、また民党議員でも地元の公共事業への予算配分を求める意見があるなど政費節減のための具体策については民党内でもまとまらなかった。
sen.e: In addition, since repayment of bonds had a higher percentage of the annual government expenditure at that time, and thus the expenditure was often reduced, and some of the councilors of minto called for budget distribution to their local public work projects, a specific measure for expense savings could not be finalized even in minto.
sen.cmt: 「削減の割合が多かったこと」の部分について、その文脈的な意味がはっきりしませんでしたので、「歳出がしばしば削減されていた」というニュアンスで訳出しました。
sen.e: In addition, the expenditure was often reduced since repayment of bonds had a higher percentage of the annual government expenditure at that time, and some of the councilors of Minto called for budget distribution to their local public work projects, indicating a specific measure for expense savings could not be finalized even in Minto.

sen.j: このため、この路線の実現方法についても意見が分裂するようになった。
sen.e: Therefore, opinions for implementing this policy were polarized as well.

sen.j: 即ち、地租改正によって結果的に幕藩体制時代よりも税率が引き上げられた東日本の地主・農民は税率の引き下げを求め、元の税率が高めであった西日本では地租の算定基準となった地価が収穫量が安定して多いという理由で、高い評価が与えられたために、税率よりも地価の引き下げを求めた。
sen.e: In other words, on the one hand, landowners and peasants in eastern Japan, whose taxation rate had been raised more than that in the era of the feudal system characteristic of the shogunate as a result of land-tax reform, demanded a reduction in their taxation rate, on the other hand, those in western Japan, whose previous taxation rate was relatively high and the land price, which was the basis for calculating land tax, was highly evaluated due to its high yield, demanded a reduction in the land price rather than the taxation rate.

In other words, while the landowners and peasants in eastern Japan demanded a reduction of taxation rate previously raised more than the shogunate and domain system after the land-tax reform, those of western Japan, whose previous taxation rate was relatively high and evaluated highly due to high yield demanded a reduction in the land price rather than the taxation rate (the land price used to calculate the land tax).
sen.cmt: 文章を滑らかにしました。
sen.e: In other words, while the landowners and peasants in eastern Japan demanded a reduction of taxation rate previously raised more than the shogunate and domain system after the land-tax reform, those of western Japan, whose previous taxation rate was relatively high and evaluated highly due to high yield demanded a reduction in the land price rather than the taxation rate (the land price used to calculate the land tax).

sen.j: 更に都市部を中心とした商工業者は地租よりも営業税 (日本)などの方が収益に対する税負担の割合が高いにも関わらず、民党が地租軽減ばかりを唱えることに不満を抱き、財政革新会などを通して独自の運動を起こした。
sen.e: Furthermore, commercial and industrial men around urban areas were frustrated by minto's assertion since it called for only a reduction in the land tax despite the fact that the percentage of taxation on profits as a business tax (Japan) was higher than that for land tax, and thus launched thier original movement through Zaiseikakushin kai (conference on reform of financial affairs) and others.

Furthermore, business and industrial men around urban areas were frustrated by assertions of Minto calling only for the reduction in the land tax despite the fact that the fraction of business tax (Japan) on profits was higher than that for land tax, and established their own movement through Zaiseikakushin kai (conference on reform of financial affairs) and others.

sen.j: 逆に政府側は地主・農民の税負担が軽くなっていることを理由に地租の増徴を計画するようになる。
sen.e: Contrarily, the government planned to raise the land tax on the grounds that the taxation on landowners and peasants had been reduced.

sen.j: 1898年に第2次松方内閣がこの構想を打ち出すと、政府と民党、あるいは地主・農村と商工業者の間で激しい議論を巻き起こすようになり、政党と藩閥の連携などの政界の構図を激変させる原因の1つとなった。
sen.e: When the second Matsukata's cabinet proposed this policy in 1898, heated arguments erupted between the government and minto or landowners/peasants and commercial and industrial men, which resulted in a cause to radically change the composition of the political world such as the cooperative relationships between political parties and domain cliques.
